did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Eduard von Bauernfeld letter and poem
did.abstract: This collection consists of a letter written by von Bauernfeld to an unknown correspondent and a handwritten poem. Both items are written in German.
did.langmaterial: These materials are written in German.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Eduard von Bauernfeld (1802-1890) was an Austrian dramatist who authored comedies and farces that addressed the social and political issues of the times. He ranked high among the German playwrights of the century, and he also wrote several essays. Prior to his career as an author, he worked for the Austrian government in a legal capacity; however, during this time he wrote several pieces harshly criticizing the government.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a letter written by von Bauernfeld to an unknown correspondent and a handwritten poem. Both items are written in German.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

acqinfo.p: This collection was purchased on March 14, 1966.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Eduard von Bauernfeld Papers must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library.
